description: This requisition is for the development, conduction, and reporting of simulation exercises for testing the capabilities of the CFIA-CAHSN laboratory infrastructure.
full_summary:
================================="">
### **[Development, Conduction, and Reporting of Simulation Exercises for Network Laboratory Preparedness : African Swine Fever and Emerging Zoonotic Diseases]**
#### from the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA)
------------------------------------------------
### **Request for Proposal [2024-00095]**
> Issued on: **July 26, 2023**
> Closing Date: **September 4, 2023 @ 14:00:00**
>
> **Selected Bidder's Opportunity:**
We invite eligible bidders to participate in this Request for Proposal (RFP) to support the development, conduction, and reporting of simulation exercises for testing the preparedness of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency's (CFIA) network laboratories, focusing on African Swine Fever (ASF) and emerging zoonotic diseases.

#### Key Invitation Highlights
--------------------------------

* **Procurement Category:** Service
* **Trade Agreements:** Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity:** Canada
* **Regions of Delivery:** Ottawa
* **Niches/ UNSPSC Codes:** Business Administration Services [80160000] and Management Support Services [80161500]

#### Proposal Evaluation Criteria and Evaluation Evidence
> Evaluation Criteria:
> - Professional expertise and knowledge in the field of laboratory preparedness and Africa Swine Fever.
> - Proposer's previous experience in managing large-scale research and simulation exercise projects.
> - Reasonableness of proposed methodology and management.
> - Compliance with the terms of the proposal requirements.

#### Get in Touch
> If interested in the opportunity, please contact:
  - Instructions for Participation and Eligibility
  - Page 3 of the Proposal Instruction Document
>
> Address Question and Clarifications to:
> - Contact: Catherine Clairoux  
>  EMAIL: **catherine.clairoux@inspection.gc.ca**
>  PHONE: **(343) 596-9265**
